DataElement.preferredName: Patient Prior Poly (ADP-Ribose) Polymerase Inhibitor Received Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response indicating whether a patient has previously received a PARP inhibitor for the treatment of cancer.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Prior Poly (ADP-Ribose) Polymerase Inhibitor Received
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Earlier in time or order._Any substance that inhibits Poly (ADP-Ribose) polymerase, an enzyme involved in detecting DNA single strand breaks and the initiation of DNA repair. Inhibition of Poly (ADP-Ribose) polymerase has direct cytotoxic effects by inhibiting DNA repair and causing cell death._To take, accept, or get something offered.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Any substance that inhibits Poly (ADP-Ribose) polymerase, an enzyme involved in detecting DNA single strand breaks and the initiation of DNA repair. Inhibition of Poly (ADP-Ribose) polymerase has direct cytotoxic effects by inhibiting DNA repair and causing cell death.:To take, accept, or get something offered.

Concepts.definition: Any substance that inhibits Poly (ADP-Ribose) polymerase, an enzyme involved in detecting DNA single strand breaks and the initiation of DNA repair. Inhibition of Poly (ADP-Ribose) polymerase has direct cytotoxic effects by inhibiting DNA repair and causing cell death.
To take, accept, or get something offered.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient received prior PA
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior PARP inhibitor therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient previously used PARP inhibitors?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior PARP inhibitors?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have a prior PARP inhibitor exposure?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received targeted therapies (such as PARP inhibitors) within 2 weeks prior to entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has prostate cancer and is eligible for a PARP inhibitor by FDA approvals, has patient received prior PARP inhibitor?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient is in the dose expansion cohort, has the patient received prior PARP inhibitors?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is in Cohort 3, does patient have (i) have had PR/CR on prior PARPi monotherapy or PARPi combination treatment; (ii) no evidence of BRCA1 or BRCA2 mutations or any of the relevant DDR aberrations listed in cohort 2; and (iii) no intervening therapy following prior PARP inhibitor-based treatment and patients with ovarian cancer should not have progressed on platinum-therapy within six months of therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has cancer for which PARP inhibitors have been approved as standard-of-care, has patient received a PARP inhibitor prior to enrollment on this study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior PARP inhibitor in the metastatic setting when given for therapeutic purposes?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is in Cohort 3, does patient (i) have had PR/CR on prior PARPi monotherapy or PARPi combination treatment; and (ii) no evidence of BRCA1 or BRCA2 mutations or any of the relevant DDR aberrations listed in cohort 2; and (iii) no intervening therapy following prior PARP inhibitor-based treatment and patients with ovarian cancer should not have progressed on platinum-therapy within six months of therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is in Cohort 3, does patient (i) have PR/CR on prior PARPi monotherapy or PARPi combination treatment; and (ii) have no evidence of BRCA1 or BRCA2 mutations or any of the relevant DDR aberrations listed in cohort 2; and (iii) have no intervening therapy following prior PARP inhibitor-based treatment and patients with ovarian cancer should not have progressed on platinum-therapy within six months of therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is in Cohort 3, does patient (i) have had PR/CR on prior PARPi monotherapy or PARPi combination treatment, and (ii) no evidence of BRCA1 or BRCA2 mutations or any of the relevant DDR aberrations listed in cohort 2; and (iii) patients with ovarian cancer should not have progressed on platinum-therapy within six months of therapy?
